1.a: The process by which one class acquires the properties and behavior of another class
1.b: The process of creating a new object from an existing object
1.c: The process of defining multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
1.d: The process of preventing inheritance in a class

2.a: To refer to the superclass of a subclass
2.b: To refer to the subclass of a superclass

3.a: The process of defining multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
3.b: The process of defining multiple constructors with the same name but different parameters
3.c: The process of defining multiple methods with the same name and same parameters
3.d: The process of defining multiple constructors with the same name and same parameters

4.a: To check if an object is an instance of a specific class
4.b: To convert an object to an instance of a specific class
4.c: To check if an object is null
4.d: To convert an object to null

5.a: A special method that is called when an object is instantiated
5.b: A method that is called when an object is destroyed
5.c: A method that is called to initialize the object's state
5.d: A method that is called to finalize the object's state

7.a: The process of redefining a superclass method in a subclass
7.b: The process of calling a superclass method from a subclass
7.c: The process of defining multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
7.d: The process of defining multiple constructors with the same name but different parameters

8.a: To prevent a class from being subclassed
8.b: To prevent a method from being overridden
8.c: To prevent a variable from being modified
8.d: To prevent a method from being accessed

9.a: A method that belongs to the class rather than any object of the class
9.b: A method that belongs to an object rather than the class
9.c: A method that can be accessed without creating an object of the class
9.d: A method that can only be accessed by other methods in the class
